name: eliin2
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wne(c0, emptycls), wb(wcel(c1, ciin(s0, c0, c2)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2))))

body.origin:
|- wi(wne(c0, emptycls), wb(wcel(c1, ciin(s0, c0, c2)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2))))
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| diffsc(s0, c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wne(c0, emptycls), wb(wcel(c1, ciin(s0, c0, c2)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2))))
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| diffsc(s0, c1)

|- wi(wne(c0, emptycls), wb(wcel(c1, ciin(s0, c0, c2)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2))))
-| diffsc(s0, c1)
-| diffsc(s0, c0)

comment: Membership in indexed intersection. See ~ eliincex for a counterexample showing that the precondition ` B =/= (/) ` cannot be simply dropped. ~ eliin uses an alternative precondition (and it doesn't have a disjoint var constraint between ` B ` and ` x ` ; see ~ eliin2f ). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)
